VLIB Function Reference

ORB

Introduction and Use Cases

ORB is an oriented feature descriptor which can be used to find and track corner-like image textures as objects or the camera pose changes from frame to frame. Compared to other competing solutions, ORB is attractive because of its good performance, low cost, and rotational invariance. ORB is short for "Oriented FAST and Rotated BRIEF". As the name implies, it builds upon the FAST feature detector, and the BRIEF feature descriptor. ORB augments FAST with an orientation and size invariance and calls the modified algorithm, oFAST. ORB also augments BRIEF with a rotational invariance and calls the modified algorithm, rBRIEF.

Specification

Method

See the APIs of each function to see the method of each.

APIS

  • VLIB_ORB_getHarrisScore
  • VLIB_ORB_bestFeaturesToFront
  • VLIB_ORB_computeOrientation
  • VLIB_ORB_computeRBrief

References

  1. E. Rublee, V. Rabaud, K. Konolige, and G. Bradski. ORB: an efficient alternative to SIFT or SURF. In Proc. of the IEEE Intl. Conf. on Computer Vision (ICCV), volume 13, 2011.
